solution:
Factor $3^3$ out of the numerator and $3^2$ out of the denominator before subtracting: \[
\frac{3^4-3^3}{3^3-3^2}=\frac{3^3(3-1)}{3^2(3-1)}=\boxed{3}.
\]
chatgpt_solution: First, we can factor out a common factor of $3^3$ from the numerator and denominator. We get: \[\frac{3^4-3^3}{3^3-3^2}=\frac{3^3(3-1)}{3^2(3-1)}=\frac{27\cdot 2}{9\cdot 2} = \boxed{3}.\]
